discovery.instruction: In Claude Code, reference the worker file with: @{worker_file}

documentation.getting_started: Claude Code is the primary agent for Czarina. Simply reference the worker prompt file using @filepath and Claude will read and follow the instructions.
tips: Use @ to reference worker files - Claude Code will read and understand the full context
Claude Code has native git integration - follow the git workflow in worker prompts
You can reference multiple files with @ if a worker needs cross-file context
Claude Code can create PRs directly using the gh CLI tool
Use Cmd/Ctrl+K to quickly find and reference files
limitations: Works best with well-structured markdown prompts
